title: I couldn't connect to my game, resulting in a leaverbuster.
body: Today I spent a good 10 minutes trying to connect to my ARAM game. I attempted three times and always got a message saying you have been disconnected from the server, please try again. This is also a game with a full party of friends mind you and they can vouch that I could not connect. As a result for losing the ARAM and not connecting I received a Leaverbuster. I was wondering if anything could be done about this because I had no control over the program not being able to connect to the server.

replies.body:
Disconnecting from a match negatively impacts everyone in it, even if the disconnections was not intentional. This is a key reason why all disconnections are treated equally and why penalties cannot be modified or removed.

There are a number of potential causes of the issues you're seeing, but the most common reason you'd experience a disconnection is due to a poor connection the servers. The guide that *Rineyy* linked will take you through the most common fixes for this, and is a good starting point in the troubleshooting process. 

If you still have issues after taking those steps, please get back to me.

When does your client crash?

I did but to be honest I was rushing to get back in so I would not get banned, and still took til 13 minutes into the game. It often crashes in transition from champ select to Game splash screen...just a guess maybe 40-50% of the time...If I use the Alpha This has not happened. I prefer to play draft mates on summoners so my time on Alpha has been slightly limited.

Crashes in champ select (of any mode) is likely a result of an unstable connection with the LoL servers. Although you stated you don't experience this on the Alpha client, still perform the steps in [this article.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/77WZOmXU-i-couldnt-connect-to-my-game-resulting-in-a-leaverbuster?comment=0000)

 If you continue to experience crashes on the Legacy client;

Repair the game by clicking the question mark icon to the top right of the patcher. Select "Repair" and let the patcher scan and repair corrupt game files. When the process is completed, you'll see the orange "Launch" button.
